sourceMeaningMnemonic: If you can write an interesting <radical>poem</radical> about <radical>winter</radical> while riding on a <radical>horse</radical>, I’ll be pretty <kanji>surprised</kanji>. It’s hard enough to write a poem as it is, let alone an interesting one. And then you’re riding on a horse and the poem has to be about winter? Heck, I’d be surprised if you didn’t fall off the horse and injure yourself.
meaningInfo: Imagine trying to write a poem while riding a horse. It’d be really hard to do. I bet you’d be surprised if you managed to do it as well.
readingMnemonic: You might also be <kanji>surprised</kanji> to learn that you are to ride this horse all across <ja><reading>きょう</reading>と</ja>. That gives you a time limit. You have until you traverse <ja>きょうと</ja> to write this poem about winter.
readingInfo: Imagine riding through <ja>きょうと</ja> on a horse. As if that wasn’t difficult enough for poem writing, now you have all the sights and sounds of <ja>きょうと</ja> to distract you as well.
